page.title: 11REAL ALE IN RADLEY GREEN
page.content: The most popular drink at the Thatchers Arms is{BITTER}at 69p a pint.It is called{REAL ALE}because it is brewed in the old fashioned way with hops,malt and yeast.It is deliv- ered every Tuesday in wooden barrels. There barrels have to be looked after carefully and not jogged as this dis- turbs the sediment.They must be kept cool and in hot weather draped with wet sacks.The landlord takes a peg out 2 or 3 days before the beer will be needed to let it breathe.Once opened, the beer only lasts for 4 days.Unopen- ed it keeps for 2 weeks.It takes skill to make sure there is always beer ready but none wasted. Very few pubs serve real ale now.Most serve a fizzy,less tasty beer from a pressurized metal barrel.It keeps for longer and does not need such care but the men here prefer the "real" thing.
